intro: Schkuhria integrifolia, commonly known as the smoothleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features basal rosettes of smooth, lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow ray flowers that bloom in spring. Schkuhria integrifolia is typically found in grasslands and disturbed soils, and it is adapted to thrive in temperate climates. Its botanical structure supports its role as a pioneer species in ecological succession.
